so today i did nothing at work....fun! i finished my book, Deborah Harry , on the PATH home..i'm still in disbelief about last night by the way...i'm like oh wow i saw Deborah Harry and Chris Stein and all of Blondie right in front of me! ...i have Rock Lobster in my head=) By the way, you know what sucks?? That's basically how much i had to pay for the ticket!! =(! anyone love me enough to go to urlLink their website and buy me one????=) i'm gonna feed kiwi and finally start Goblet of Fire ...

wow wow WOW! i don't even know where to begin.... tonight urlLink shane and i went to see the urlLink B-52's and urlLink BLONDIE ! IT WAS SO AWESOME!!!! our seats were in the second row in front of the stage-center-aisle!!! So B-52's play and we're dancing and then they end without playing one of the coolest songs ever (which i was obsessed with sophomore year of college): Rock Lobster ! But then they come back and do an encore...the first time i think i've ever seen an opening band do an encore...and they play it!!! I was going nuts it was great!!!!! Anyways, then Blondie comes on and as soon as I see Deborah Harry i'm freaking out! (actually i was freaking out about seeing her before then) So they play a new song...then Dreaming (yes!), then Hanging on the Telephone (yeeeeeeah!) and during it the security guard tells us to go against the stage so for the rest of the show I AM RIGHT UP AGAINST THE STAGE RIGHT IN FRONT OF DEBORAH HARRY!!!! i still can't believe it.... it was so awesome and the played so well and her voice was amazing!!!!! SHE WAS DANCING INCHES FROM ME! AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (i'm not a dork i promise)

urlLink weezer tonight with urlLink van , urlLink ro , billy, & co... it was amazing! they played so much old stuff!!! they played 2 songs off the green album, like 3 off the new one, and the rest were pinkerton and blue album! we were sooo happy! off the top of my head they played tired of sex , my name is jonas , say it aint so , the good life , el scorcho , falling for you , sweater song , holiday , buddy holly , getchoo , no one else , and why bother? ! GOOD STUFF! rivers was acting weird, but thats nothing new i guess.. heehee... and me and van were wondering where the giant =w= were the whole time.. and then in the middle of the sweater song the platform pat and his drums are on raises up in the air and it's under it! it was so cool!! it was worth sitting through dashboard wah wah wah confessional hehe... ok goodnight=)

(aw yeah! aw yeah!) august 10th is my last day. by the way, jim (the manager) made me an award! like, he made it-it's not from the store..fuuuunny! and i tried a vanilla coke and, van, you were right, it was yummy. so anyways, today i'm driving home on the turnpike and i go to merge right and, yeah, hi?, i have no mirror there!!!!!!! someone stole my mirror when i was working last night!!!!! sadfadowdsodkjwdwi!!!!!!! >=( this week coming up is my last week of my internship at urlLink ny1 news . i know it was work and all and i had to wake up early and commute into ny and all that, but i'm gonna miss it.. i had fun there and the people were awesome! i've taken polaroids at work and i'll put them up whenever i get my lazy (_|_) into gear! ugh everyone was partying last night while i was working and getting my mirror stolen=( we should party this saturday!!!! oh yeah and we only got outta work at 4:15!!!!!!!!!!!! i have that 'party hard' song in my head. it's been there on and off since last night when some girl was wearing the t-shirt i can't remember what else i was gonna say so until then i'm gonna go eat ice cream.

i am so tired! we got back from florida today=(! i wanna go back to sunshine and fun stuff! we had alot of fun..i don't know what to say really cause if i went into details i don't think anyone would care that much to hear about my vacation..brief summary: friday we got there in the morning and then hung around the pool at the hotel, the polynesian, (which for all of you don't know ahem ahem is hawaiian stuff) and then went to a luau there at night where a guy pulled rosemary onstage=)! that was the BEST! anyways..so then the next day we went to the magic kingdom and went on every ride..at night ro and i went to pleasure island while my parents went to epcot..that was lots of fun..the next day we went shopping then drove to my uncle's house and my cousins came over and we all went out to eat..then the next day we went to his community's pool and then came home! then on the plane ride home we had to hover because newark airport had an 'emergency'! of course when they said that everyone on the plane got nervous..does anyone know what happened?? well, like i said, i'm tired so i'm gonna go....first a few words for rosemary: chicken around the pool..robert..the wig..mommy's questions..ohana means family..and babycakes!! goodnight=)

(my london shoes!) the ones i kinda ruined when i wiped out on the way to class?? WELL.. i went into a shoe store at the mall and THEY HAD THE SAME ONES! i freaked out!!! i think i almost hugged the people who helped me! =) they're a little different..not AS quality...but look basically the same =) i also bought a couple tops and a new jean jacket from jcrew ;)...the weird thing that happened was when i was in old navy..some girl comes up to me and says: 'Has anyone ever told you you look like a model??' i was like WHAT?!?! i thought either she was crazy or she was selling something (or she was hitting on me)...so she goes on to tell me how she's a scout for a talent agency and i have the features that would make a good model! i was laughing..i probably made her feel kinda dumb but i couldn't help it...she invited me to a meeting but i told her i couldn't go cause i go to school in new brunswick....funny though, huh?=)

SO you wanna hear about my day so far? (it's only 3:47 pm but it feels like it should be 10pm!) : OK, take a deep breath and.....go! so you remember from yesterday how I'm sick? well i was feeling better last night so van, urlLink rachel , kris, & i went to the diner for an american cheese fiesta pretty much, but later on in the night i was feeling not so hot. i fell asleep around 2:30 am.... SIX FORTY FIVE AM: SQUIRREL ATTACKS BEGIN! **wait wait..i don't remember if i ever told the story of the squirrel. van & i share a room in the upstairs of our house..(rachel is in the other room upstairs & christine is downstairs)..so we've been hearing weird rustling noises coming from the ceiling & walls for awhile .. turns out this squirrel made a hole in the window frame of one of the windows to me & van's room (which, by the way, is at the foot of my bed) and she's crawling in & out of there every day and running around in the frame of our house. our landlord had the hole sealed last week.** OK back to the day at hand. so, yeah, 6:45 am i get woken up (feeling yucky sick) to noises coming from the infamous window..i look up and see the squirrel sprawled on the window climbing around! so it starts making weird squirrel yelling noises and keeps running around the outside of our house b/c obviously it's home was sealed. next thing i know christine runs upstairs & i hear her telling rachel that there's a squirrel in our house downstairs! so awhile goes by..rachel calls pest control & they basically laugh at her & tell her to tempt it out of the house with peanut butter on ritz crackers. so rachel is freaking out (and rightfully so) cause the squirrel is going nuts and chewing the bottom of the front door. eventually (at like 9am-ish) i get the squirrel to leave our house via the front door. so yeah...there's poop on the couch & kitchen floor and everything seemed so yucky. rachel & christine had classes & van was sleeping so me..sick of course...had to sweep downstairs & clean everything to disinfect it...finally at 10am..i can get the rest i need..i decided since i only slept 4 hours i'd skip my first class to rest...lay down to go to sleep....then........about a half hour later....... I OPEN MY EYES AND A SQUIRREL IS SQUIRMING INTO THE WINDOW ABOVE MY BED! i SCREAM, "The squirrel is in our room!!!!!!!!' so van gets up and we FREAK out...OI! so i run downstairs & open the door and grab crackers and peanut butter and leave them around to lead her to the door..but she won't come out from under my bed (where we find out later she was pooping incessently). so i call the landlord who reassures me that he's sending someone either today or tomorrow to take care of it and tells me to open the windows. so i call kris cause he likes squirrels. he comes over in his pj's and for a long time the three of us are thinking up plans upstairs. the best part was when kris & i went into my room to open the window (the squirrel was STILL under my bed) and van was in rachel's room to try to coax it down the stairs if it came out. the squirrel jumps out, i scream so it runs to rachel's room..van screams so it runs to my room..i scream so it runs to rachel's room..van screams,etc..................so it ended up in rachel's closet..rachel came home & finally kris chased it out the front door! sigh it's not over yet. so two minutes later pretty much the squirrel is back on the outside of van and my room window laying on top of the air conditioner and making its weird squirrel yelling noise! rachel van and i moved the air conditioner out so it can't squeeze into the window again(i hope). SO we've (that is, rachel vanessa and i) spent the ENTIRE day (van and i in our pajamas....all of us unshowered) cleaning our rooms like CRAZY! seriously, this squirrel pooped so much it's inSANE. so, yeah, everyone please keep us in your thoughts that we don't get eaten by the squirrel who KEEPS attacking our house.. yes, she's still out there...making her squirrel yelling noises................

THE ATTACK OF THE PARKAS! people, parkas are taking over new brunswick.... it hit me when i was walking to my last Film Genres class, i had to stop in the comp lab beforehand-all around me in the lab, all around me walking to class, people in parkas! grey ones! brown ones! white ones! red ones! all different parkas on all different people!! i'm not one who likes to categorize people or put 'labels' on them, but looking at things in that way, every type of person in this University has a parka!! think i'm ridiculous? go outside and walk down college ave. or easton ave., or sit in the student center or comp lab, and look around! it's insanity i tell you! i personally don't understand all the craziness.. they remind me of the coats that boys in my third grade class would wear and their heads would look really small.. but hey, if that's the look you're going for than go for it! in my opinion, i hope this is a fast moving 'fad' for the sake of cold weather. not that i'm fashion guru in any way shape or form, but what is it about those big coats with fur lined hoods that's got everyone going bananas? if someone can explain this to me than i'm all for it. if not, so be it. it's not the end of the world (maaaaaybe) but it's crazy! and it's actually not just new brunswick.. sadly i think it's taken over the country-or at least parts of it. people, if you haven't fallen victim to the subliminal parka-loving messages or whatever is going on yet, then maybe it's not too late! RESIST THE PARKA!!!! if i've offended anyone i'm sorry-that wasn't my intention. this is a joke-i just find parkas amusing and the fact that they're trendy even funnier! but people can be good people and wear parkas, too, it's just clothes... that's all for my little rant=)

so last night after the bowling bday party(!!) at which rosemary won worst bowler (yeah ro!) i went w/her & her friends to a bar in hoboken where this band that all looked like nelson(think 80's...long blonde hair...dj tanner's poster on full house) played the weirdest mix of music from 'Blitzkrieg Bop' to 'HotHotHot'..i think my favorite point of the night was 'my name's earl! and this is earl!' and the worst was rosemary killing my cell phone in a sink full of dirty water! last night was fun & yummy!! (the food!) blah i'm an idiot cause it's not just analog behavior playing saturday at the somerset inn, it's jack nebraska, too.. go urlLink see for yourself . also, i know this will be the third post in a row of amsterdam talk, but i just wanted to say a couple things about it that have nothing to do with little inside jokes and memories for amsterdam crew... amsterdam. it's pretty there..canals, canal houses, cobble stoned streets, antique and art shops everywhere..but the people are also so great. i mean, i know holland isn't the only place that exists like this, but the people were all different types, like it didn't matter at all how you appeared, and they all talked and hung out and had great times. we'd walk into a place and people would start talking to us and sometimes they would be from different countries as well. it was just like people (no matter where they came from or what they're into) getting to know people. like at paradiso when we saw the kills, and even when we went dancing, it was all different 'types' of people having fun together-it was so great. no feeling of being looked up and down, no disgust at pretentiousness. and also, yeah weed, shrooms, and prostitution are legal so it might seem like the place would be a mess, but it's so much nicer there than here. everyone lives fine under those conditions. mind you, there are restrictions on that stuff, but just like how much weed you can carry with you at a time and stuff like that. their government doesn't just take everything away from them, they found a way to work with them, so that it's really not abused. (the tourists probably do the most abusing!) they work together with the people and it works. SO! who wants to move to amsterdam?! (did i mention the reasonable pricing on food & clothes???) hehe ;) ps

UGH that night was so much fun!!!!! since i'm the only one that doesn't have a digital camera, i don't have pictures-so i'll have to link to the 3 of their's when i can.. saturday rachel, van & i rearranged our house somewhat & then van & i had a lovely dinner followed by a lovely evening in nyc with fid and craig! actually we only got to cinema classics (gogo night?) at 12:30 and got home at...8 am?? i don't remember! i brought my polaroid camera into work yesterday b/c one person i work with alot who i really like, julia, is going to be out next week (my last week) and i wanted to take work pictures before i was done-what a day to have my camera.... so i get to work and i need to go by film for my polaroid. i run to duane reade across the street & then come back. i get in the elevator & press 9. doors close. the little screen that tells you what floor you're on says "9" but the doors don't open. i'm all by myself in the stupid elevator so i start pressing door open and 9 buttons. finally after literally 5 minutes the elevator jerks upward and leaves me on 8. (IT WAS AN OMEN-I SHOULD HAVE GONE HOME RIGHT THEN!) so anyways I go upstairs & they threw a surprise little lunch going away party for me in the conference room=)! it was so sweet! and as a present, julia gave me these sunglasses she used to wear in 1964 that are big and checkerboard b/c she said they looked like they would fit me-she always calls me marlo (thomas) or gidget-heehee. anyways so lunch-yum-i took a bunch of polaroids of people & stuff (which i'll post). then, back to work. a couple hours later.... ....i'm sitting in my little cubicle using my computer & the tv over my head that plays cnn only goes static. i didn't think too much of it. then i notice the lighting is weird. i look up and the light right above me is flickering, but everyone else's is fine. then-ZAP! tv, lights, computers, etc are all out. i go over to where my sister & the departments i work with are & we're all just like what the??? someone looks out the window & says how the traffic lights are out & people in other buildings are looking out at us & the street too. the building alarm is going off. someone comes around and says we have to leave so we all grab our bags & walk down the stairs. masses in the streets! no traffic lights! no one knows what the hell is going on & some people are getting nervous. we're all waiting around to see what happens when one of my bosses with a radio says that the power is out-blablabla (you all know it by now). so the boss says we should all go home-does anyone need a place to stay, etc.. me, my sister, amy & 2 other new jerseyans decide to walk to port authority from where we are. walking the streets of nyc was insane. HORDES of people walking in the heat, cars and trucks going everywhere b/c of no traffic direction (a hot dog truck almost hit me). masses of people outside the ny public library. finally we get to port authority & like everyone else finds out-no buses. (i snapped a shot of the crowd outside). so we walk to the lincoln tunnel, they aren't letting people walk through it. (there's a bunch of people trying to get rides from cars that aren't moving anyways). so we go to the ferry and join the MOB . (i snapped 2 shots of the crowd there, too). so-yeah-we wait packed in with 100,000+ people in the heat to get on the ferry. it was so crazy that people were ripping open the fence to get into the crowd. (i snapped a shot of amy holding the fence open.) there were like 10 helicopters hovering over us-sirens everywhere-pandemonium! everyone kept saying how on 911 it was so much easier to get home cause there was some sort of order. there was a 1 week late pregnant lady among us who had to be taken away bc she went into labor! anyways so after waiting for hours and hours and hours on the line, it becomes dark out and finally cools off a bit. luckily, one light turns on right by the ferry entrance at which point the crowd cheers. so FINALLY we get on the platform (one of the people with us starts yelling NEW JERSEY I CAN SEE YOU!!) and we get on the ferry. (they couldnt tell us where the ferry would go-we'd just have to get on one). so we get dropped off in weehawken. after walking and walking and waiting and waiting we have to walk from weehawken to hoboken to my sister's apartment-but i didn't care bc i was finally out of the city. so we stop at this place and get gatorades and literally inhale them for lack of hydration.... ....LUCKILY my sister's apartment was one of the few who had regained power. b/c of traffic i stayed there (as did a bunch of her friends whose apartments DIDN'T have power). my parents said at our house we didn't have power either, so that was even more of a reason for me to stay. but-her elevator wasnt' working. as we climbed the stairs to her apartment we both agreed that we felt like we had just been to war. i said 'this is one for the bloooojjjjj'...after inhaling food & talking to everyone about our days while we watched 'drive me crazy', we went to SLEEP. ...i woke up today and finally my phone worked!! but my body felt like lead. (thanks rosemary for everything!) what was everyone else's experiences like??

it looks like the old lady in the basement isn't alone.... so last night i woke up from a really weird dream for no good reason, and just as suddenly with no good reason i turned around to look right at the curtain wall/partition in my room & i saw what looked like the figure of a civil war type man (hat & everything) with feet off the ground. seriously i could not move at all, and i couldn't say anything. finally i got myself to grab the tv remote next to my bed and turn on the tv to bring light into the room. of course the light turned on and it was just curtains-and i wasnt wearing contacts or glasses-but MAN this scared the bejesus out of me. (plus of course i started thinking of sadako!) sigh..i convinced myself it was nothing and i eventually fell asleep an hour later, but seriously-i'm scared to sleep in my room tonight=( ps in case you haven't heard, i'm engaged to beavie.

I recommend: - rewatching the original 'The Texas Chainsaw Massacre' - seeing the new version of 'The Texas Chainsaw Massacre' - not watching 'The Texas Chainsaw Massacre 2' ...I couldn't decide whether I liked the new version out in theaters now or not since it's so different. But afterwards when everyone was talking about it, it did seem better that it was a new 'Hollywood-ized' version of the concept of the story rather than a new 'Hollywood-ized' complete redo of exactly everything (like the Gus Van Sant 'Psycho' remake a few years ago). Anyways, either way, it scared the bejesus out of me & everyone else in the theater, so that says something!

i would'a never wanted to enter if i knew that's how it worked. the poor guys, the whole alley was watching them... the first one got NINE pins and the second got a gutter ball! oops. so when it closed we headed to the knight club to visit chip which we also haven't done in awhile! so he gives us 2 free pitchers (yay) and then rachel and i are having this long conversation sitting next to each other at the bar when all of a sudden these two guys come over....oh my goodness..."my" guy's name was NIO! LIKE EL NIO! which i kept calling him because he kept calling me sarah at first and then roxanne...he also kept telling me i have the prettiest eyes blablabla-oi. i was like yeah does that line really work for you? i kept looking at van and fid and chip and so did rachel but no one helped, they just laughed-thanks guys! when they left we clued chip in, so next time he's becoming one of our boyfriends just in case. so then we came home and FINISHED the immense amounts of pasta stuff i had made before plus tator tots were made. after two group hugs i went upstairs to watch clue and hit the hay. when rachel came in my room at 10 i wanted to kill her but thanks for remembering to wake me up rachel=) ok i'm gonna go kick that guy out of my room! it's 1 o'clock already!

(new years, that is.) i had so much fun! i don't think i can write the entire adventure but i'm so glad it was 100 times better than last year's new year's! i will say that i love that at midnight i was around a bunch of people i really like, champagne in hand, screaming the countdown with the bar while dick clark's rockin eve is on (and amy is yelling DICK CLARK!), to then be greeted with hugs and kisses of new years (van first! aw) all night from more people i really like. the people that were around definitely made the night! i had a vivid dream this morning right before i woke up that i went to atlantic city by myself but my parents & aunt & unlce & gramma ended up being there, too, and i played 1 slot machine & won $5000..so i decided to run to my car as fast as i could (with my bucket of quarters that equalled $5000) to make sure i didn't lose it. however-on my way to the car i saw these 2 guys sitting at a table in the parking garage & announced to them that i had won $5000. they asked me where it was & i said that it was in the bucket. the one guy said, 'That doesn't look like $5000 to me!', so I look down & sure enough the bucket was filled with peanuts. i should've been dissapointed right? no-i still insisted that the peanuts were $5000 & took off in my car, driving on the sidewalk of AC cause i didn't know where i was going! then i woke up (that half wake up where you're not quite awake) and thought i really had won 5000 dollars/peanuts...but i quickly realized that i was in bed & it was all a dream. I WANT MY 5000 DOLLAR PEANUTS! anyone wanna go to ac? haha ps. does anyone read this? maybe when i leave nb (soon!) i'll stop writing in here so it seems like i've dissappeared off the face of the earth & i can be just a memory..(that is, except for when i visit nb almost every weekend ha!) pps. urlLink rachel posted pictures from my bday night in nyc...please take into account that i was the bday girl when you see my drunk eyes! haha [your comfort is my silence.]
